page.title: 09THE BRIGHTON BYPASS
page.content: The idea of the Brighton ByPass is a motorway standard road designed ro relieve Brighton of heavy traffic as many vehicles have no business in Brighton but forced through it. The planning was started for a ByPass in 1973 and 6 different routes were put under scrutiny.In 1974 the proposed route was announced and it was to go around the edge of Patcham very close to Mackie Avenue.In 1978 the Structure Plan was approved and an exhibition was held in Brighton Town Hall in 1981. The Secretary of State passed the Inspectors report following a public enquiry on the 11th May 1984.Work should start in Autumn 1986 and take 4 years to complete.
